titleStmt.title: The poor mans counsellor, or, The marryed mans guide. If God have blest thee with a careful wife take my directions how to lead thy life, tho riches thou dost want yet thou shalt find far greater wealth in a contented mind, thy honest labours shall thy charge maintain, being truly got, not by unlawful gain. Tune of, The poor man's comfort,.

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Come friend if thy leisure permit thee to stay ..."
Cf. Wing P2865A, which has "councillor" in the title.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
